clusters.title: Enrollment Growth
clusters.description: Homeschooling in the United States has seen significant growth, with an estimated 2.5 million students homeschooled in 2020, representing 5.2% of all school-aged children. This marks a notable increase from previous years, such as the 2011-2012 school year, where approximately 3% of the school-age population was homeschooled. Current figures suggest nearly 4 million students are now being homeschooled nationwide. Additionally, the financial impact of homeschooling has been substantial, with national tax savings estimated between 3.7 and 9.9 billion dollars over various years.
